class.name: PhysicsBone3D
class.brief_description: A PhysicsBone3D is a RigidBody3D that tracks or modifies a bones pose.
class.description: A PhysicsBone3D is a RigidBody3D that tracks or modifies a bones pose. When free simulate is off, the physics body tracks the bone. When free simulate is on, the physics body modifies the bones pose.

method.name: get_bone_id
method.description: Returns the bound bone id or -1 when the [PhysicsBone3D] is loaded into the scene.

members.member: The bone name from the parent [Skeleton3D] to track/modify.
The bone offset represents the bone local-space offset for the center of mass of the [PhysicsBone3D]. Modify this value to change the bones center of mass.

If free simulation is on, the physics bone will act as a proper rigid body and simulate. Its simulation will be propagated as a global pose override in the [Skeleton3D] for the associated bone id. If free simulation is off, the physics bone will be set to kinematic mode and follow the position of the bone from the skeleton.
If this node is a child of a [PhysicsBoneCompensation3D], set the magnitude of velocity change to inherit from its tracked node.
If this node is a child of a [PhysicsBoneCompensation3D], set the magnitude of rotation change to inherit from its tracked node.

If this node is a child of a [PhysicsBoneCompensation3D], set the threshold angle after which the bone will "teleport" and clear its velocities instead of free simulating. As an example, if the tracked node of the [PhysicsBoneCompensation3D] rotates more than 180 degrees (3.14) in a single frame, you can set the value to 180 degrees (3.14) to indicate that the bone should teleport instead of simulate to that position.
